Objectives: Napoleon wanted to keep control of France and fight the Allied forces
Results: The British Army won, with the help of the Prussian and Dutch forces
Tactics: Napoleon lined up troops in three columns and threw them at the British line while the British formed a steady V-shaped defense
Contributions: Field Marshal Blücher sent Prussian troops to aid the British forces at the last moment, preventing them from being encircled by Napoleon’s troops
